meanings.sent1: She outpreached all the other speakers at the event.
meanings.sent2: The pastor outpreached his colleagues with his powerful sermons.
meanings.sent3: The young preacher outpreached the old minister, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for preaching outpreached any doubts the audience had.
meanings.sent5: His voice outpreached the noise of the bustling city, capturing everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: To preach better or more effectively than someone else.
meanings.sent1: He always outpreached his competitors with his compelling speeches.
meanings.sent2: The visiting preacher outpreached the local clergy with his moving message.
meanings.sent3: The student outpreached the teacher during the debate, leaving the class in awe.
meanings.sent4: Her words outpreached any previous attempts to change their minds.
meanings.sent5: The preacher's sincerity outpreached any doubts the congregation had about his message.
